intro: Braya novae-angliae, commonly known as the New England brake, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It has basal leaves that are pinnately divided, and its fruit is a short, segmented silique. Braya novae-angliae is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is considered a rare species in its native range.
